intro: Cacalia theophrastifolia, commonly known as the Persian bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia. It has hairy stems and leaves that are opposite in arrangement. Cacalia theophrastifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and can thrive in full sun to partial shade.
